column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The Charter of the United Nations sends a clear message to us all : put people first .
#Text=The first words of the Charter , “ We the peoples ” , are a summons to place people at the centre of our work — every day , everywhere .
#Text=People with anxieties and aspirations , people with heartbreaks and hopes and , above all , people with rights .
#Text=Those rights are not a favour to be rewarded or withheld ; they are an endowment for simply being human .
#Text=Throughout the first half of my mandate , I have had the good fortune to meet people around the world , not in gilded meeting rooms but where they live , work and dream .
#Text=And I have listened .

#Text=I have heard families in the South Pacific who fear their lives being swept away by rising seas ; young refugees in the Middle East yearning for a return to school and home ; Ebola survivors in North Kivu struggling to rebuild their lives ; women demanding equality and opportunity ; people of all beliefs and traditions who suffer simply because of who they are ; and so many others .
#Text=We are living in a world of disquiet .
#Text=A great many people fear getting trampled , thwarted , left behind .
#Text=Machines take their jobs , traffickers take their dignity , demagogues take their rights , warlords take their lives , fossil fuels take their futures .
#Text=And yet people believe in the spirit and ideas that bring us to this Hall .
#Text=They believe in the United Nations .
#Text=But do they believe in us ?
#Text=Do they believe that , as leaders , we will put people first ?
#Text=We the leaders must deliver for we the peoples .
#Text=People have the right to live in peace .
#Text=One year ago in this Hall , I spoke of winds of hope despite the chaos and confusion of our world ( see A/73/PV.6 ) .
#Text=Since then , some of those currents have continued to move in promising directions .
#Text=Against the expectations of many , elections unfolded peacefully in Madagascar , the Maldives and the Democratic Republic of the Congo , to name just a few places .
#Text=Greece and the Republic of North Macedonia resolved their decades - long name dispute .
#Text=Political dialogue in the Sudan and the peace process in the Central African Republic have brought renewed hope .
#Text=A long - sought step forward has just been taken on the political path out of the tragedy in Syria , in line with Security Council resolution 2254 ( 2015 ) .
#Text=As I announced yesterday , an agreement has been reached with all parties for a credible , balanced and inclusive Syrian - owned and Syrian - led constitutional committee .
#Text=My Special Envoy just left Damascus after finalizing the last details with the Government and the opposition .
#Text=The United Nations looks forward to convening the committee in Geneva in the coming weeks .
#Text=However , across the global landscape , we see conflicts persisting , terrorism spreading and the risk of a new arms race growing .
#Text=Outside interferences , often in violation of Security Council resolutions , make peace processes more difficult .
#Text=Many situations remain unresolved , from Yemen and Libya to Afghanistan and beyond .
#Text=A succession of unilateral actions threatens to thwart a two - State solution between Israel and Palestine .
#Text=In Venezuela , 4 million people have fled the country — one of the largest displacements in the world .
#Text=Tensions are heightened in South Asia , where differences need to be addressed through dialogue .
#Text=Above all , we are facing the alarming possibility of armed conflict in the Gulf , the consequences of which the world can not afford .
#Text=The recent attack on Saudi Arabia ’s oil facilities was completely unacceptable .
#Text=In a context where a minor miscalculation can lead to a major confrontation , we must do everything possible to push for reason and restraint .
#Text=I hope for a future in which all the countries of the region can live in a state of mutual respect and cooperation , without interference in each other ’s affairs .
#Text=I hope equally that it will still be possible to preserve the progress on nuclear non-proliferation represented by the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action .
#Text=From the first day , I have emphasized prevention , mediation and a surge in diplomacy for peace in order to address the crises that we face .
#Text=Consider the lives that we can save by strengthening our investments to sustain peace around the world .
#Text=Across some of the most troubled corners of the world , some 100,000 United Nations peacekeepers protect civilians and promote peace .

#Text=Through the Action for Peacekeeping initiative , we are strengthening our effectiveness and efficiency and we are renewing partnerships with troop - and police - contributing countries , host countries and regional organizations , such as the African Union and the European Union .
#Text=I am also proud of the work of our humanitarian workers , easing suffering around the world .

#Text=Fully half of all international relief aid is channelled through the United Nations , ensuring that millions receive protection , food , medicine , shelter , water and other life - saving forms of assistance .

#Text=This year alone , in brutal attacks and other circumstances , we have lost at least 80 peacekeepers , humanitarian workers and others , all of whom gave their lives serving the United Nations and trying to better the lives of others .
#Text=I honour their service and their sacrifice .
#Text=We have bolstered our counter-terrorism architecture and defined new strategies to tackle violent extremism and to address root causes , while respecting human rights .
#Text=I have put forward a new disarmament agenda to advance global peace .
#Text=In the near term , the New START Treaty must be extended .

#Text=We must work to address the heightened threat posed by ballistic missiles and ensure a successful 2020 Review Conference of the Parties to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons .
#Text=The situation of the Korean peninsula remains uncertain .
#Text=I fully support the efforts towards a new summit between the President of the United States and the leader of the Democratic People ’s Republic of Korea .
#Text=At this time of transition and dysfunction in global power relations , there is a new risk looming on the horizon that may not yet be large but it is real .

#Text=I fear the possibility of a great fracture — the world splitting in two , with the two largest economies on Earth creating two separate and competing worlds , each with their own dominant currency , trade and financial rules , their own Internet and artificial intelligence capacities and their own zero - sum geopolitical and military strategies .

#Text=We must do everything possible to avert the great fracture and maintain a universal system — a universal economy with universal respect for international law , a multipolar world with strong multilateral institutions .
#Text=Speaker Nancy Pelosi delivered remarks on the Floor of the House of Representatives in support of H. R. 1280 , the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act .
